Issue.creator: smithbk
Issue.summary: Improve usability of cop client enroll/reenroll commands

description.enrollmentSecret: -url // default is "http://localhost:8888 -hosts // default is local hostname -alg {ecdsa | rsa| // default is 'ecdsa' -keysize // default is 256 -O -OU -L -ST -C -jsonfile {code} And the reenroll command is identical except there are no arguments. So it is as follows: {code} cop client reenroll -url // default is "http://localhost:8888 -hosts // default is local hostname -alg {ecdsa | rsa| // default is 'ecdsa' -keysize // default is 256 -O -OU -L -ST -C -jsonfile {code} Each of these options should also be settable via a new CLI command as follows: {code} cop setvar cop getvar {code} The setvar simply sets the variable in the $COP_HOME/config.json file and the getvar simply returns the value. The precedence is: 1) command line option is highest precedence 2) value in is next, if specified 3) environment variable is next ... if using viper, this is easy 4) value in $COP_HOME/config.json lowest precedence 5) default value if there is one for the field. The ones with default values are specified above in the usage message. The default values are specified in the usage. >
